unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **smart meter rollout gains momentum in maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program across the state. As of today, 02/11/2024, over 2.5 lakh smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like Pune and Nagpur, with plans to expand coverage to rural regions by Q2 2025.
normalised: mumbai, maharashtra – the maharashtra state electricity distribution co. ltd. (MSEDCL) announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program across the state. as of today, second november two thousand and twenty four, over two point five lakh smart meters have been installed, primarily in urban areas like pune and nagpur, with plans to expand coverage to rural regions by Q two two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The initiative, aimed at reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses and improving billing efficiency, has seen positive initial results. Real-time data monitoring is now possible, enabling faster detection of power theft and network faults.
normalised: the initiative, aimed at reducing aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses and improving billing efficiency, has seen positive initial results. real-time data monitoring is now possible, enabling faster detection of power theft and network faults.

unnormalised: MSEDCL officials stated during a press conference at 14:00 hrs yesterday that the smart meters are compliant with Indian Standards and feature advanced security protocols to protect consumer data. A dedicated 24/7 helpline (1912) is available for consumers facing any issues. Consumers are invited to information sessions at various Vidyut Bhavans on 15/11/2024 to learn more. The investment in this project is approximately Rs. 500 Crores and aims to replace all conventional meters within the next 3 years.
normalised: MSEDCL officials stated during a press conference at two P M yesterday that the smart meters are compliant with indian standards and feature advanced security protocols to protect consumer data. a dedicated twenty four seven helpline (one nine one two) is available for consumers facing any issues. consumers are invited to information sessions at various vidyut bhavans on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty four to learn more. the investment in this project is approximately rupees five hundred crores and aims to replace all conventional meters within the next three years.
